background: A manufacturer needs to determine the optimal monthly production quantities for different types of parts, taking into account machine time constraints, machine costs, sales prices, and minimum production requirements.
constraints: Number of batches for each part is non-negative
Total time used on each machine does not exceed its Availability
At least MinBatches of each part must be produced
objective: Maximize the profit, which is the total sales minus the costs of using the machines
description: How many batches of each part should the manufacturer produce each month to maximize profit? The number of different parts is \param{P}, the number of machines is \param{M}. There is a \param{TimeRequired} matrix detailing the time required to produce one batch of each part on each machine. Each machine has an associated cost given by \param{MachineCosts} and a monthly availability given by \param{Availability}. Each part can be sold for \param{Prices} and there is a minimum production requirement for each part detailed by \param{MinBatches}.

parameters.definition: Time required to produce one batch of part p on machine m
Cost associated with using machine m
Availability of machine m per month
Selling price of one batch of part p
Minimum number of batches of part p to be produced
